revised_title: Multinucleate Cells in Vegetative Tissues: A Study on Their Origin and Significance
tldr: This article discusses the occurrence of multinucleate cells in the vegetative tissues of various plant species. The authors observed that multinucleate cells are common in young, actively growing tissues and that the plurality of nuclei arises through mitosis, not amitosis. They also describe a unique process called "phragmosphere" formation, where a hollow sphere encloses the daughter nuclei in binucleate cells. This research contributes to our understanding of plant cell development and differentiation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
